title: Who was the last king of Czechoslovakia? - Quora

response.answer_text: No-one. Czechoslovakia was formed after World War I, as a republic. Formerly, Bohemia (a part of it) had been a kingdom in the Hapsburg empire, while Slovakia had been part of Hungary. The last non-Hapsburg king of Bohemia was Vladislaus II or his son Louis, both Kings of Bohemia and Hungary (Louis died 1526) .
